title: ISic000517. I.Sicily inscription 000517
body:
1M(arco) · Marcio · M(arci) · f(ilio)
2Cla(udia) · Bieti · Glauco patri
3senatoris · equo · pu-
4blico · exornato · pa-

6quae · in · cives · suos

8inter · tribunicios

1M·MARCIO·M·F
2CLA·BIETI·GLAUCOPATRI
3SENATORIS·EQUO·PU
4BLICO·EXORNATO·PA
5TRONO·OB·MERITA·EIUS
6QUAE·IN·CIVES·SUOS
7CONFERT·C·V·ADLECTO
8INTER·TRIBUNICIOS
9AB·IMP·CAESARE
10[[M·AUR·COMMODO·]]ANTO
11NINO·PIO·FELICE
12AUG·TRIBULES·TR͡IB
13IOVIS·AUG·PECUN͡IA
14SUA·L·P·D·D·D

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text: CIL

English translation

Alex Antoniou

To Marcus Marcius Bietis Glaucus, son of Marcus, of tribe Claudia, father of a senator, honoured with the public horse and patron on account of his merits which he conferred upon his fellow citizens, vir clarissimus, adlected amongst the tribunes by the Imperator Caesar Marcus Aurelius Commodus Antoninus Pius Felix Augustus, the tribesmen of tribe Jupiter Augustus [gave this] with their own money. This place was given at public expense by decree of the decurions.

commentary
